intro: Ryssopterys discolor f. stipulacea, commonly known as the stipulate form of the white-veined fern, is a rare and distinctive variant of the species. It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring stipules—small, leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalks. The plant exhibits a delicate, feathery appearance with finely divided, lance-shaped fronds that are pale green with a white-veined pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. This form is prized by botanists and horticulturists for its ornamental value and genetic uniqueness.
